place.name: LONDONTHORPE
place.gazetteerText: LONDONTHORPE, a village and a parish in Grantham district, Lincoln. The village stands near Erminestreet, 3 miles NE of Grantham r. station; and contains a number of neat small houses in the Gothic style. The parish comprises 1,520 acres; and its Post town is Grantham. Real property, £2,614. Pop., 228. Houses, 46. The property is divided among a few. The manor. and much of the land belong to Earl Brownlow. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Manthorpe, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church consists of nave, S aisle, and chancel, with porch and tower; and is a neat stone edifice. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
